It bums me more than anything to say that I do not recommend this game anymore.

I have been playing since late 2017 on the Xbox, moved over to steam a few years later.

While I love this game, and always will, the direction it has taken isn't healthy. To begin, a lot of people have found the newly added MMR system to be a bit draining and I happen to be one of those people. Your MMR is spread evenly among your survivors and each one of your killers has a unique MMR, but still have a baseline rating. That sounds great, but where the problem lies is how it tracks your rating. Survivors are tracked through how often they escape the trail and how long the match lasts. Killers are tracked on how many survivors are killed and how long the match lasts as well. This is heavily flawed, there is so much more to a round of Dead By Daylight than how many kills you achieved or if you escape or not. If MMR is the direction the team is going in, it should be reading the game as a whole, not just the end of the match. 

Behavior should take a step back from the big DLC releases to diagnose the health of their awesome game. What would help Dead By Daylight is a big bug fixing/balance changing patch. With each and every chapter being pushed, it feels as if the game takes one step forward and two steps back. While the state of the meta pushing more towards the new boon totems and anti-loop killers, why not give some light to everything else? Bring some low-performing killers into the spotlight, change gimmicky perks or optimize the performance of the game? Dead By Daylight would benefit hugely by a big patch. Get people excited about this game again!

Lastly, the community would love more transparency. Tell use your thoughts, Behavior, acknowledge us. We want what is best for the game and we hope you do too.

I think it goes without saying that I am not finding this game fun anymore. Countless hours spent learning this complex game and leveling up my characters will forever be cherished, but I cannot play this game right now. I do hope Behavior takes a step back and outlines what they are going to do from this point. Dead By Daylight will never die, it has a monopoly in the asymmetric horror genre, but it is sure gonna lose some of its playerbase.

ok time to whine...
I bought this game when it first came out. but didnt play for a few years because it had no customs at that time and i wanted to play with my family and didnt realize that we could play survivor together if that was even a thing then im not sure. my family had said it wasnt. once i realized you can i started playin avidly about 3 or more years ago. (after i missed the blight prestige skins sadly :( )
This game is a very fun idea, and can be a lot of fun but the grind is serious. i kinda like that about it though because im a ladder climbing kind of person. BUT the community is the most toxic of any i have ever seen. and bhvr dont take any the probs seriously dont feel like. face camping and tunneling has become the only way to play for killers and that wont change. that is fun for nobody. the only survivors who have fun are the sweaty ones these days. im not sweaty and never will be. we arent all pros. i want a casual game not a hidden ranked mode. the game also needs a look behind you button like a lot of games have because that fancy spin crap on pc is not gonna happen for me. i can only look behind me on xbox but i play on pc. yes thats my problem but why not a simple button to swivel ur head like on red dead or rust? im tired of being hit over windows when im 3 inches over them by then because ping. i am tired of the killer sidedness of it while killers say its vice versa. its not unless they are going against a sweaty swf. im tired of being singled out by a skin or a perk. or my gender. the list goes on. 
do i love this game? yes. do i wish a ton of changes for it? yes. honestly i consider quitting every day unless it changes. and im getting nearly there. but if you are a sweaty type player or toxic in general then you will probably love it.

Seriously, this is a like a toxic relationship. Every time I think I'm done, I come crawling back, and for what? 
* The community is awful. 
* The matchmaking takes forever. 
* As soon as update comes out, it's better for you to uninstall and reinstall the game instead of it patching itself.
* As soon as one bug/error is fixed, more come in its place.
* Every game plays out the same. There is no change-up in anything. If you're a survivor, all you do is repair generators with stupid QTE, and get killers who either tunnel you or hook camp. Or you're a killer, with either way too much power, too little power, or an awful group that it doesn't become fun. 
Seriously, fuck this game and the studio behind it.
Frustrating. You die. A LOT. But Absolutely mind boggling-ly fun. Worth a shot, try both Killer and Survivor to find your groove. READ EVERYTHING. Don't skip tutorial. Happy Slaying.

This game is made very well! It's really fun and immersive.  The sounds of the game's environment, surviors, killer, and even the killer's song captures you. There are so many survivors and killers to choose from. The skill based matchmaking allows you to have a different and fair game each time you play. You play with different survivors and killers that match your skill level every game. It is definitely worth getting and playing!
yay dbd
very good yes

This game can be very fun sometimes. I have played off and on for years now (only have 80 hours), and I can say without a doubt this game is a different kind of toxic. I have given up being a killer. I always get matched with top rank survivors with cross character skills. I cannot say for sure if they have comms, but it is endless loops, lots of trolling, and the inevitable bombardment of horrible comments in the post match lobby. Before you say the obvious, I KNOW. I need to get better. Only way to do that is by grinding and after getting matched with so many sweats who are itching to show what 7000 hours can do - I am not interested anymore. I play more survivor now. Still get matched with killers I have no business playing against but it is more bearable. Still get trolled, body blocked, and witness the toxic chat very frequently. Survivors working with the killer is definitely a buzz kill but what can you do? Reporting does pretty much nothing.

I do think this game is very fun if used for private matches with friends. If you are new to the game you are too far behind. The matchmaking will be kind for a few games, but soon the door will be opened to show this game's true colors. Vicious cycle of unfair matchmaking, survivors trolling because of unfair killers, and killers trolling because of unfair survivors (from their previous games).

The current and upcoming DLC is cool. If you happen upon one of their big sales then I would recommend buying. Otherwise, save yourself the trouble. The try-hards and etc. probably do not agree with this but they are not the ones this is for (they just want more noobs to troll and hook lol).
